preamble: In this section you will descibe acquisition set-up, which software you have used, impedance upper treschold, what type of online reference, recording channels, VEOG and HEOG and online filters.   NOTE: If you notice a bug, or have a suggestion, we'd be grateful if you posted an issue on GitHub: https://github.com/INCF/artem-is/
question: What software did you use for the acquisition?
Specify software version if applicable, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
Did you document impedances, or an alternative data aquisition quality measure?
What is the appropriate acquisition data quality measure for the recording equipment?
choices: impedance upper threshold | impedance range | a data quality measure alternative to impedances

question: What was the upper threshold of impedance that was registered in this study?
What was the lowest impedance registered in this study?
What was the highest impedance registered in this study?
Report data quality measures provided by the recording system alternative to impedances.
Was voltage measured relative to an online reference for EEG electrodes (as opposed to alternative solutions such as Driven Right Leg (DRL))?
Location of the EEG online reference electrode(s)
What alternative to an EEG online reference (for example DRL) was used?
EEG online reference location other than listed
Location of the ground electrode during recording
Online reference for VEOG electrodes
choices: bipolar (lower - upper VEOG) | the same reference as EEG electrodes | other | VEOG was not recorded

question: Which other reference was used for VEOG recording?
Online reference for HEOG electrodes
choices: bipolar (left - right HEOG) | bipolar (right - left HEOG) | the same reference as EEG electrodes | other | HEOG was not recorded

question: Which other reference was used for HEOG recording?
Online reference for other non-EEG (and non-EOG) electrodes
choices: the same reference as EEG electrodes | other | no non-EEG non-EOG electrodes were used
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: this question was a text question by mistake, changed to radio  27.11.2023 Angela rephrased question and options

question: Which other reference was used for other non-EEG (and non-EOG) electrodes?
Which of the following online filters were used?
details: Select "none" to mark this question as answered if you did not use any online filters. Please note that this case is highly unlikely given that acquisition systems normally have at least an anti-aliasing low-pass filter.
choices: high pass | low pass | notch | none
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: added additional instructions in the "details" section

question: High-pass filter cut-off used during recording
Type of online high-pass filter cut-off
High-pass filter roll off used during recording
High-pass filter impulse response during recording
choices: finite impulse response (FIR) | infinite impulse response (IIR)

question: Type of online low-pass filter cut-off
Low-pass filter cut-off used during recording
Low-pass filter roll off used during recording
Low-pass filter impulse response during recording
choices: finite impulse response (FIR) | infinite impulse response (IIR)

question: What notch filter was applied online (during recording)?
Center frequency of the online notch filter
In which format do you want to report the width of the offline notch filter?
choices: distance between 3 dB points | number of removed frequencies in a decrete Fourier transform

question: Distance between 3 dB points
Number of removed frequencies in a descrete Fourier transform
Were any harmonics also removed by the online notch filter?
Which harmonics were removed by the online notch filter? List center frequencies separated by a semicolon and a space
Acquisition sampling rate
